korean: 요즘 주말에 밀프렙 하는 게 루틴이 됐어.
평일에 요리할 시간이 없어서 일요일에 몰아서 준비하거든.
먼저 일주일 식단을 대충 짜는데, 이게 생각보다 귀찮아.
마트 가서 재료 사는 것부터 시작인데, 리스트 만들어도 뭔가 빠트려.
집에 와서 재료 다듬고 손질하는 데만 1시간은 걸려.
현미밥도 미리 해놓는데, 냉동실에 소분해서 보관해.
반찬도 몇 가지 만드는데, 계란찜이나 나물 같은 거.
용기에 담는 게 또 일인데, 테트리스 하는 기분이야.
냉장고가 작아서 공간 배분이 진짜 중요해.
다 하고 나면 저녁 때가 되는데, 완전 지쳐.
근데 평일에 밥 걱정 안 해도 된다는 게 큰 장점이야.
아침엔 용기 하나 들고 나가면 되니까 편해.
건강도 챙기고 돈도 아끼고, 일석이조지 뭐.
english: Meal prepping on weekends has become my routine these days.
I don't have time to cook on weekdays, so I prepare everything on Sunday.
First I roughly plan the week's meals, which is more annoying than you'd think.
Starting with going to the mart to buy ingredients, even with a list I forget something.
Just prepping and cleaning the ingredients at home takes like an hour.
Chicken breast and broccoli are the basics, and I steam sweet potatoes too.
I make brown rice ahead of time and store it in portions in the freezer.
I also make a few side dishes, like steamed eggs or seasoned vegetables.
Putting everything in containers is another job, it's like playing Tetris.
My fridge is small so space management is really important.
By the time I'm done, it's evening and I'm totally exhausted.
But the big advantage is not having to worry about food during the week.
In the morning I just grab a container and go, so it's convenient.
I'm taking care of my health and saving money, it's two birds with one stone.
At first it was annoying, but now I'm used to it so it's okay.
